## Bio

Hi! I'm Haosen He, a research fellow at Stanford Law School. I graduated from Wake Forest University in 2022 with a B.S. in Mathematics and B.A. in Economics (Summa Cum Laude). I'm interested in Game Theory, Law & Economics, and the intersection of Machine Learning & Causal Inference. I will apply for Ph.D. in Economics this year.

## Publication

“An agent-based model of elephant crop consumption walks using combinatorial optimization”
with Erin Buchholtz, Frederick Chen, Susanne Vogel, and Chu A.(Alex) Yu. ***Ecological Modelling*** (2022).

## Work in Progress

“Modeling behavioral response to infectious diseases under information delay” (Honors thesis in Economics)
with Frederick Chen and Chu A.(Alex) Yu. *submitted, Review of Economic Design*.
